Conducts comprehensive assessment of the patient incorporating data from a variety of sources in a systematic and timely manner.
Applies a systematic approach to patient monitoring and data interpretation.
Identifies common and urgent variances in patient assessment data.
Completes safety checks and sets alarms appropriate for the patient.
Recognizes emerging patterns and trends in the patient's responses and reassesses the patient's condition accordingly.

CUES
Collects cues from multiple sources to build comprehensive understanding of the patient's situation.
Processes assessment data to determine priority cues.
Anticipates appropriate interventions based on cues from the patient's data.
JUDGMENT
Forms clinical judgments about patterns in the patientâ€™s data.
Determines priorities of care based on available patient data.
Determines priorities of care based on available patient data.
Forms clinical judgments to identify urgent and/or emergent situations by interpreting patient's assessment data.
Determines whether independent or collaborative clinical decision-making is required.
DECISION-MAKING
Initiates appropriate interventions based on identified variances in the patient's assessment.
Initiates appropriate interventions based on urgent variances in the patient's assessment
Incorporates contextual factors into clinical decision-making.
Provides consistent care that ensures the patient's safety and well-being.
Articulates reasoning and rationale for patient interventions.
EVALUATION (reflection in action)
Evaluates the patient's response to intervention and takes appropriate actions
